Matt,
That is an unusual design.  I see it as a variation on the nanban style "cupped" guard.  Rather than forging a cupped plate, it looks like the three lobes were carved out.  The cupped nanban guards were usually (always?) mounted with the convex side facing the nakago/hand.
Jim



  http://www.aoi-art.ab.psiweb.com/fittings/itaku/main.html

  no. 19. 

  Ian any ideas ? :-)

  Seriously, strange design no ?

  Matt
